content.description: A beam of monochromatic light passes through a single slit, as shown, producing a diffraction pattern on a screen. The first minimum is a distance <math alttext="y sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>y</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math> from the central peak. The distance between the slit and screen is much greater than \(y_1\). The frequency of the light is then doubled.
content.question: What will be the new distance of the first minimum from the central peak?

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator y sub 1, and denominator 2" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator y sub 1, and denominator 2" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
